AGRICULTURAL SCIENTIST

Ocean Spray Cranberries, Inc. is currently looking for an Agricultural Scientist to support our Cranberry Grower-Owners in Washington. The successful candidate will work out of Ocean Sprays facility in Markham, WA and be part of a team of Ocean Spray Agricultural Scientists that serves our growers industry-wide.

Position Summary: Develop and implement research and outreach programs to support all phases of agricultural production for Ocean Spray Grower-Owners in Washington. Advise grower harvest timing and help coordinate fruit deliveries to OSCs receiving facilities. Provide support to programs/initiatives in the areas of crop supply planning and pesticide-related risk management. Coordinate efforts of University/government scientists, grower organizations and chemical industry professionals to focus on solutions to agricultural production issues.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Provide on-farm technical support to Grower-Owners.
  • Conduct applied research to address key production, pest management, and environmental needs. Work collaboratively with external (e.g. university) scientists as appropriate. Manage seasonal technicians if needed.
  • Implement outreach programs for Grower education and to facilitate research technology transfer.
  • Execute field sampling programs to support crop estimation, field inspections (supports contract management) and fruit samples for pesticide residue analysis.
  • Be an integral member of our team of OSC Agricultural Scientists and work collaboratively with the OSC Agricultural Operations (fruit receiving) network to ensure timely delivery of high quality fruit.
  • Provide IPM (Integrated Pest Management) services and formulate management recommendations based on IPM data.
  • Represent the Cooperative as an information resource on matters relating to the overall business.
  • Be familiar with the Cooperatives rules and recommendations for GrowerOwner conduct in relation to producing and delivering the crop.
  • Review and approve Pesticide Use Reports for individual farms.
  • Attend Grower Industry meetings, workshops, and gatherings.
  • Cooperate with university/government scientists, grower organizations, and chemical industry professionals to address issues important to the cranberry industry.
Decision-Making Authority/Accountability Level:
  • Development of project designs and their implementation and the execution of relevant outreach programs.
  • Analyze compensation for Grower-Owners where research leads to loss of crop.
  • Responsible for securing and approving Grower-Owners pesticide use reports prior to delivery.
  • Coordinate activities of external scientists/specialists to maximize positive impact on Grower-Owner on-farm profitability.
  • Work in conjunction with Operations personnel to execute fruit delivery programs (e.g. fresh fruit, quality audits, delivery scheduling, etc.).
  • This position will be required to work extended hours during harvest season.
Knowledge, Skill, and Ability Requirements:
  • Bachelors, M.S., or Ph.D. degree in agricultural sciences, pest management, crop management, soil science or related discipline (e.g. entomology, plant pathology, weed science, horticulture).
  • 3 or more years of experience in one or more of the areas stated above.
  • Must be self-directed and independently motivated.
  • Driving is required (Company vehicle provided) so candidates must have a valid drivers license in good standing.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.
